sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Czech Republic came to a standstill at midday Saturday as the country observed a minute of silence as part of a national day of mourning to honour the victims of this week's mass shooting at Charles University in Prague.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: National flags on public buildings were at half mast and bells tolled at midday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: President Peter Pavel and speakers of both houses of Parliament attended a service with the general public. Students also lit thousands of candles at makeshift memorials at the Faculty of Arts and the university headquarters nearby, where the shooting took place. The shooting inside the university's Faculty of Arts on Thursday killed 14 people and wounded 25 before the gunman killed himself. Police and prosecutors say they have evidence the 24 year old shooter also killed his father earlier in the day as well as a man and baby in Prague last week. The investigation is still ongoing. Poland's new foreign minister, Radoslaw Sikorski, has chosen Ukraine for his first visit abroad

sentences.sentence: Sikorski urges Kyiv's allies to mobilize their economies to support Ukraine's military, which is fighting off invading Russian forces. We cannot allow Russia to produce more on the basis of a much smaller economy, because war does not win by tactical strikes, production wins.
